abstract: News Analysis; Thailand's military junta's legislative assembly votes overwhelmingly to impeach former Prime Min Yingluck Shinawatra, barring her from public office for five years; junta indicates Shinawatra will be indicted on charge of criminal negligence; actions threaten to prolong conflict in country and dispel junta's claim to being honest broker.
lead_paragraph: The decision to prosecute Yingluck Shinawatra, who enjoys the support of the provinces, risks prolonging what has already been a lost decade of economy-sapping protests and coups.
snippet: The decision to prosecute Yingluck Shinawatra, who enjoys the support of the provinces, risks prolonging what has already been a lost decade of economy-sapping protests and coups.

keywords.value: National Council for Peace and Order (Thailand)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: In Targeting Ex-Premier, Thai Junta Takes a Risk
headline.print_headline: In Targeting Ex-Premier, Thai Junta Takes a Risk
